Package com.intellij.openapi.editor.impl

Class TextChangeImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.editor.impl.TextChangeImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TextChange

    public class TextChangeImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements TextChange
    Default TextChange implementation with mutable state.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextChangeImpl

        public TextChangeImpl(java.lang.CharSequence text,
                      int start)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Shorthand for creating change object with the given arguments where 'end index' has the same value as 'start index'.
        Parameters:
        text - text affected by the current change
        start - start index (inclusive) of text range affected by the change encapsulated by the current object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if given start index is invalid

      • TextChangeImpl

        public TextChangeImpl(java.lang.CharSequence text,
                      int start,
                      int end)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates new TextChange object with the given arguments. It encapsulates information about the change that may be applied to the target document.
        Parameters:
        text - text that is introduced by the current change
        start - start index of the target document location where current change is to be applied
        end - end index of the target document where current change is to be applied, i.e. it's assumed that current text change appliance to particular document causes replacement of its original text at [start; end) interval by the text encapsulated by the current change. I.e. original text is replaced by the new one
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if given start or end index in invalid or they are inconsistent to each other

      • getText

        public java.lang.CharSequence getText()
        Allows to retrieve text that is directly affected by the change encapsulated by the current object.
        Specified by:
        getText in interface TextChange
        Returns:
        text related to the change encapsulated by the current object

      • getChars

        public char [] getChars()
        Allows to get change text as a char array. Note that it's not guaranteed that change text directly maps to the returned char array, i.e. change to array content is not obeyed to be reflected in getText() result.

        Generally speaking, this method is introduced just as a step toward existing high-performance services that work in terms of char arrays. Resulting array is instantiated on-demand via CharArrayUtil.fromSequence(CharSequence), hence, it doesn't hit memory if, for example, CharSequenceBackedByArray is used as initial change text.

        Specified by:
        getChars in interface TextChange
        Returns:
        stored change text as a char array

      • getDiff

        public int getDiff()
        Difference in document symbols number after current change appliance.

        Note: returned number may be either positive or not. For example it may be negative for 'remove' or 'replace' changes (number of text symbols is less than number of symbols at target change interval)

        Returns:
        difference in document symbols number after current change appliance

      • advance

        public void advance(int offset)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Applies given offset applied to the start and end properties of current text change object.
        Parameters:
        offset - offset to apply to the current change object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if start index becomes zero after given offset appliance (it is not applied then)
